code:
# Magic Dedicated Wallet Twitch Social Login

Please [click here](https://magic.link/docs/authentication/features/social-logins/social-providers/twitch) for full implementation instructions
explanation: This block is a social login feature that allows users to log in with their Twitch account credentials, providing a dedicated wallet experience on Twitch.
repository_explanation:
Here is a concise explanation:

**Repository:** `magiclabs/twitch-oauth-demo`

**Purpose:** Demonstrate Twitch OAuth authentication in a simple web application.

**Content:** A basic web demo showcasing how to use Twitch's OAuth API for user authentication, likely including example code and setup instructions.
file_summary:
Here is a concise and holistic summary:

"Twitch Social Login: A seamless authentication feature allowing users to log in with their Twitch account and enjoy a dedicated wallet experience on the platform."

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
  <head>
    <meta charset="utf-8" />
    <link rel="icon" href="%PUBLIC_URL%/favicon.ico" />
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1" />
    <meta name="theme-color" content="#000000" />
    <meta
      name="description"
      content="Web site created using create-react-app"
    />
    <link rel="apple-touch-icon" href="%PUBLIC_URL%/logo192.png" />
    <!--
      manifest.json provides metadata used when your web app is installed on a
      user's mobile device or desktop. See https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/web-app-manifest/
    -->
    <link rel="manifest" href="%PUBLIC_URL%/manifest.json" />
    <!--
      Notice the use of %PUBLIC_URL% in the tags above.
      It will be replaced with the URL of the `public` folder during the build.
      Only files inside the `public` folder can be referenced from the HTML.

      Unlike "/favicon.ico" or "favicon.ico", "%PUBLIC_URL%/favicon.ico" will
explanation:

This code initializes a Magic SDK instance with an OAuth extension for authentication. It creates a single instance of Magic, configured with an API key and the OAuth extension, which allows users to authenticate via external services like Google or Facebook.

explanation:
Here is a concise summary:

**Block Purpose:** Social login functionality using Magic OAuth and Twitch as the authentication provider.

**Functionality:** Redirects user to Twitch for authentication, then redirects back to the dashboard after successful login.
